Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife and baby. Pros: Good facilities. Professional reception. Crib was ready in room when we arrived. Parking available close by and costs 32$ tax included. Modern room. View to pool, quiet. Denny's close by for breakfast. Great location near fisherman's wharf. Cons: Small room, but not very small (stayed in a king bed room). Shower head, although modern, isn't convenient. Noise from A/C. Breakfast not included in room price. Internet not included in room price. Only single elevator that gets to the exit without stairs (there are additional elevators that reach to half a floor below the exit). On site valet costs over 50$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf and enjoyed our stay. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The gym is very nice and the pool and spa, although small, were clean and well maintained. The hotel is right by fishermans wharf, which is not quite as attractive a part of San Francisco as I remember it being on my first visit in 1998. You can easily get downtown from the wharf and you have plenty of opportunities to walk the streets and do some exploring for yourself. My one criticism of the hotel, indeed the Hyatt chain in all likelihood, is that it is so expensive to get wireless internet in the rooms. We went to the starbucks around the corner where we got a coffee and free wifi instead. I realise that the majority of Hyatt customers are perhaps business travellers who don't really care, but a little thing like free wifi for paying guests would be nice. At least they are consistent and don't give you free wifi in the lobby so any old stranger can just walk in and get online for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chloe6090
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 2011. We had a Respire Room which overlooked the pool The Room was very clean, the bed was fantastic we slept very comfortably. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. A lot of things are within walking distance. We ate at Knuckles which was very good and across the street was a little restaurant which also had wonderful breakfasts. I can't remember the name - sorry. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Shuweb
Reviews.Content: We booked the room for one night directly with the hotel; we made a reservation for a hypo-allergenic room, which is something that they offer. The reservation process, of course, was very smooth. At check in, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite - and my what a wonderful room! There's a half bath as you enter the suite, and a very large living room, consisting of large leather "sofas" and glass table, and a separate area with "lounge chairs," a smaller table and a large flat screen TV. There was a place to chill the wine, etc. And further into the suite was a separate bedroom, with a very comfortable bed, another TV, and of course a nice "walk in closet" and a large bathroom. I place "quotes" on some of these words because I honestly don't know what they're called; I just know that they were very nice. The staff were very nice; they remembered our name, and were very responsive. We were in SF for a dinner with friends at Roy's (which by the way was terrific!), and we decided ahead of time to spend the night in SF rather than drive home that night. My only comment is that breakfast was only OK. The buffet selection was lacking, and the pancakes just weren't good. I'd consider going elsewhere for breakfast. As for location, it doesn't get much closer to Fisherman's Wharf. This was great because we left our car at the hotel and walked to Pier 39 early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LoveourholsBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt on our first visit to San Francisco. The hotel is very well located a few blocks back from the wharf, with shops en route. It is in a fairly quiet street, so although we werent facing the street, I wouldnt imagine noise was a problem. Our room was very nice, a good size, and overlooked the pool. (not that we used it as the weather was a bit chilly for our liking - tho others did.) There was no kettle, but there was a coffee maker which produced a reasonable cup of coffee. We didnt eat in the restaurant/bar, but we did have drinks there and it was pleasant enough. The concierge was good at recommending restaurants and places to go, and reception staff were always very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy hotel - make sure to be placed off the main street”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravellerSJ
Reviews.Content: What a terrible stay. I'm a loyal Hyatt customer for years, yet this is the second time I've stayed at the Fisherman's Wharf location and had a horrible night's sleep. Most of the rooms are located on the busy North Point street with plenty of auto and bus traffic. Because we were on the 5th floor and the rooms aren't well insulated, we could hear every engine, drunk person and seagull outside our window. For the money, it's better to stay at the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero which is a short street car ride to the Wharf. Please note for Hyatt Gold Passport members, this location does not have a regency club nor a good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: joanjustjj
Reviews.Content: Get the packaged deal, which includes breakfast, it was delicious! The room was very, very clean and this hotel was in the perfect location- down by the warf and pier 39.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring San Fran”
Reviews.Author: dillydallying
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was in a perfect location as a base for exploring San Francisco. Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and right at the Cable Car turn around for the Powell/Mason line. I suggest going to the Wharf and for a cable car ride; both are touristy, but still quite fun. The hotel staff were incredibly nice and upon check-in offered us a valet parking rate for the self-park rate (still $36/day, but that's what it'll cost in San Fran for parking anywhere). The hotel room was nice, with comfortable beds and very clean, but it's beginning to show a little wear and tear. We booked this hotel because it has a pool, not many do in San Francisco, and the courtyard with the pool was nice and we swam, even in February. This area is starting to show its age as well. We ate at the attached Knuckles restaurant and the food was quite good, with some nice wines. Go for the AAA-rate with breakfast included and this hotel is a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Why not try the Hyatt, a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RESPOO
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a long weekend at the Hyatt, I spend alot of time researching hotels before travelling. You will not be dissapointed even with the perk of a great price on Travel zoo, including breakfast. We found all the staff very accomendating, not one issue. If you are travelling with a family of four, reserve the oversized room, lots of space. Fisherman's Wharf is really a one day event, but traveling to Union Square is easy, either by taxi or cable car. The cable car is expensive, but really you have to say you did the ride. Next time we will stay in the Union Square area. There is a safeway store two blocks away if you would like to pick up grocery items, a fridge request at the hotel is a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a great price”
Reviews.Author: cherbear305
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, very nice rooms, very easy to walk everywhere and very helpful staff. Our room rate came with free breakfast buffet and valet parking which is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Easy walking distance to wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Aeroplay
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value. Look at the travel search engines for a price base line then call them direct for the best deal. Our room was great and the breakfast buffet was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bassngal1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. If I had say something bad about it, The halls to the rooms are darks and the carpet is old. I can live with that. All of the staff was friendly and helpful and even made me laugh a couple of times. The rooms were clean clean. The price was outstanding for San Francisco. The pool was fabulous. The hotel is located near everything. Room service was wonderful and the food in the restraunt was wonderful. One hint don't bother paying for the City view, you get to see a Borders book store. I would stay at this hotel again and again. The staff was wonderful to my children acknowledging them everytime they walked or ran by.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay - would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: journeyman29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of february and everything was faultless. For a very good value price we had an enormous room (with 2 double beds), a fantastic choice for breakfast and a superb location. The hotel also had a reasonable size pool and outdoor hot tub which we didn't use and a decent size fitness room. Moreover, the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly throughout the stay. We ate in the hotel bar on two of our nights in San Fran and whereas the menu selection was somewhat standard bar-fare, the quality of the food and the service were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Standard - clean & decent hotel, nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: elzny
Reviews.Content: OK maybe I've been spoiled. After my stay in LA's Beverly Wilshire, I came to Hyatt at the Wharf, I don't have much to say. It's a standard hotel, like the Westins & the Sheratons. To be fair, the hotel is clean & staff is friendly & courteous. Rooms are on the smaller side but adequate. Actually I don't mind smaller rooms - so that I don't have to hike 20 steps just to go to bathroom - as I did at the Wilshire. Bed was comfortable, my room is facing the pool so it was quiet & I slept well. I checked in late & left early to catch a flight, so I didn't use any amenities. The location is a bit far - 10-min cab ride on average to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MANY EXTRA CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: 4CBL
Reviews.Content: $50 to park ! No free internet access and no using 2 computers on the same internet charge. Bad shower.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel but they downgrade you instead up upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_0
Reviews.Content: We spent ages looking for the ideal hotel in San Fran, it was between the Fairmont Ghiardelli and the Hyatt Fishermans. We eventually chose the Hyatt because it was somewhat cheaper and ticked many of the boxes in terms of Modern Decor, and we specifically called and requested the corner deluxe room due to its size, and it was about GBP 300 cheaper for the 3 nights than the other hotel. Upon arrival and check-in we were advised our corner room was not available but they have downgraded us to a smaller room taken $50 off for each night. I told them it is unacceptable because we had spent weeks if not months choosing and preparing for our room choice. I also mentioned that one normally gets UPGRADED when the hotel cannot fulfill our booking. (There were conferences being held there which may have not helped our situation) We grudgingly went up to see the downgraded room. We decided to take the room as the room was still fine in exchange for breakfast on all 3 days, the $150 off and a bottle of wine. That aside we took our things up and made peace with the new abode. The room was relatively large (called an oversized room), Modern, spacious, had an entire wall of windows which was great. The bathroom was clean and big and luxury with a massive walk-in shower. I guess a bath would have been nice - but we just used the hot tub downstairs instead. We did find some men's toenail clippings that had been missed when the room was cleaned up before our arrival - but they sent someone to sort it out. The room had a flat screen tv with cable channels, a massive kingsize bed, coffee machine and they had moved a portable refrigerator up for us and there was an ipod dock alarm clock.- Nice touch! The room was quiet and faced onto the pool and hot tub. Biggest hotel complaint is the lack of free wifi. Ended up costing an additional $30 and only one of us could use it at a time. Breakfast at Knuckles was great - loads to chose from from scrambled eggs, to pancakes, to potatoes to cereal - I had the guy make me an omelet which was divine. Our package included two full day transport passes/muni passport which meant you could ride the bus and cable cars as much as you wish - very useful. Cable car turnaround is a block behind the hotel, two starbucks' nearby. The piers of fisherman's wharf were about 5 minutes away and ghiardelli square about 10 mins walk. Its a bit touristy but it is very well connected to the rest of San Francisco within minutes. Good restaurants are the Plant Organic restaurant on Pier 3 (take a cab - like 6 quid or walk for 20 mins) and also the Boudin on the actual wharf was great. All in all i did like the hotel and would return as they did try and put any problems right and the hotel was really clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beechinor
Reviews.Content: 1. Walking distance to fishermans warf, and alcatraz departure pier. Expensive parking, but that is what you get in the city. easy to drive to. Extremly friendly and accommodating staff. The rooms were nice updated rooms with good beds. The hotel was clean but is a high volumn high traffic hotel. I would stay here again if I was doing activities by the water.

Reviews.Title: “the most friendly staff in the world”
Reviews.Author: mauithunder
Reviews.Content: It did not matter what time or what staff member they were all very friendly and nice thank you hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cam67_99
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weeks stay in San Francisco. The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is in such a great location and so close to everything. Would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a good hotel in a great location. Also, the staff here at the hotel were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Badbreath
Reviews.Content: Tough place to get a cab from at 7:45am, and they threw me in a town car and took me to BART. Great service and a killer price from Hotwire ($139) for a hotel this nice in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bobhns
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Fisheman's Warf is a excellent place to stay. The Warf is just 2 short blocks away, excellent location with cable car pickup a block to the South, VERYfriendly staff, clean rooms, and Knuckles Sports Bar and Grill is a very good place to relax in the evenings. I was working downtown and Lous made my stay very pleasant. In fact, the entire team did. From the shuttle to downtown, to the excellent service while at the hotel, to Mary Jane the bar tender in Knuckles. It was a great experience over other places I've stayed in the city. This will be the hotel I stay at everytime when returning to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler77California
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Hyatt hotel. Excellent location....nice, clean, modern hotel. The staff was friendly and the concierge was helpful as well. Parking was expensive but at least we had in and out privileges. Internet was not free. They gave us a fridge upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Do you need a bath-tub?”
Reviews.Author: Rorry
Reviews.Content: All good but just be careful about bathroom selection if this is important to you! Only rooms with 2 double beds have a bath-tub (with shower over the bath). The king bedded rooms have a shower only. For me, a shower would be fine, but my wife is a bathing person and so we had to change from the over-size King room that we'd booked. They didn't have an over-size double so we took a standard double, which was fine. Bizarrely, the bathroom was huge! Room (inwards facing) was extremely quiet and the beds comfortable. They comp'd us breakfast to make up for not having the larger room and I would say the breakfast was fine as it was free, but I think $18+tax+tip each would have been far too much everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose this hotel for a visit to San Francisco. We were SO glad we did! Looking at all of the other reviews you can bet this hotel is located in a prime spot for tourists! It is about a block and a half from the wharf so you can EASILY walk it in less than 5 minutes and far enough that you don't get any wharf noises or smells! I feel like this is the nicest hotel I could get for the low price of $149/night. Yes, it stinks that they charge $45/night to park here ($51.30 w/tax) but even at $200/night I couldn't find a nicer hotel especially with this great location! I drove all over the area looking for alternate overnight parking. There is a shopping center across the side street but they have signs that they'll tow for non customers and the parking meters all around hotel (and town) are 1 hour maximum and $3 per hour! It just costs money to park in SanFran! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. It was my daughter's 21st birthday so they sent up a bottle of wine and a lovely bowl of fruit. We also requested a mini refrigerator and it was delivered happily and quickly with no extra charge! The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The shower had great pressure and I had no complaints. The hotel has been renovated, however, the hallways are dark and show signs of age. (That is just nit-picky.) The hotel is clean and nice and a great value. Also, the free wireless internet is a plus and was not taken for granted. So many hotels still charge and we had great service! We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but did notice there was a Denny's across the street. Also across the side street is World Market where we got bottled water, liquor, snacks, candles, etc and next door to that is Barnes and Noble with a Starbucks and a Starbucks across the street from that!! (Yeah! TWO right there!) Right next to where you can catch the trolly. It turns around right there!! Go! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location;very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hgee
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after much deliberation in Tripadvisor. There was no choice but to use valet parking in this area as many others have pointed out,however as a member of the UK AA we got the AAA discount on the parking rate. On arrival the desk staff were very friendly and efficient and when we got to the room we were very impressed.The room was large,well appointed and very clean.15mins afterwards we got a call from the desk to check if everything was to our liking;we've never had that before!! We were given a quiet courtyard view room as requested on the top floor.Several people have remarked about the shower;we didnt really find it a problem during our 4 night stay. Room service was fine;of particular note was the courteous attitude from all the hotel staff which made our stay so enjoyable. We were able to print our boarding cards in the free 15mins allowed online. It was a real pleasure to stay at the Hyatt;it is very convenient for all Fishermans wharf attractions whilst being sufficiently far away from the piers and bay front shops to be an oasis of calm after a hard day pounding the streets!! Recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nondescript hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: patrick_s7
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a recent weekend away in SF. Overall stay was positive. I choose it for location and I definitely had no complaints on that front. Easy walk to pier area and all the tourist things in Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel itself is pretty standard. They have obviously spent some money recently on re-doing the lobby and rooms. Newer furniture and you can tell that they are trying to go for more style. My room was a good size, clean and quiet. Staff were generally very helpful. I checked in very late on a Friday night and the night clerk wasn't very knowledgeable about the area. Suggested Denny's as late night eating option when I found several places open after midnight on my own. Also wasn't sure how long it would be to walk to the Alcatraz pier the next morning. On the other hand, he was so friendly that I really didn't mind. Overall I thought that is was solid value for the money. If you want to be by the Wharf and need a nice, non-flashy hotel, the Hyatt is a solid pick. In terms of tips, there are a lot of different recommendations about Union Square vs Fisherman's Wharf. I visited both spots. A friend of mine who grew up in SF recommended staying somewhere other then Union Square. Great during the day but seedy at night. I was surprised by that but take it for what it is worth. Also recommend the Alcatraz tour. Standard tourist thing but very, very interesting. Other then that SF is a great city to walk around. I walked through Chinatown to Union Square very easily and took the cable car back.

Reviews.Title: “Good service.”
Reviews.Author: jadaaa
Reviews.Content: Everyone we encountered was courteous, friendly and helpful. We ate at their Knuckles restaurant the night SF Giants won the pendant and the food was good, portions substantial and our waiter was great even with all the noise and excitement. The only down side was our "view" which was of two homeless people on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: rasjve
Reviews.Content: The staff people were great and service was awesome. I would totally come back and stay at this hotel which I booked through priceline.com! Our rooms were clean. Not much for scenery because we were placed in the inner part of the hotel, but the rooms made up for it. Valet is pricey, but its San Francisco. If you don't need to get a car, I suggest just doing a shuttle and then public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in touristy fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Great hyatt property. Close to EVERYTHING touristy in SF. Used cable car to get to union square which was great and used F Streetcar to get to Ferry Terminal and Embarcadero and BART with no problems. Starbucks, gas station, plenty of restaurants all within a block or two. Didn't get a chance to experience Knuckles because of the World Series, but looked like a great place. The room was very nice, comfy bed, great shower only bathroom. Love the Hyatt bath products. Nice flat screen TV, good working desk, checkin / checkout was extremely quick with the computer screen kiosks. Hotel also had a good workout area and outdoor pool, didn't get to use but both seemed nice. Was really very impressed with this hotel as I received a fantastic rate from Priceline I didn't have high expectations. Would definitely return to this Hyatt location again if I need to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “cozy znd comfy”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: Getting to this hotel is not really hard. You can take the share a ride airport van that would cost you less than $20 per person. However, It would take approximately 3 stops before the driver will take you to your destination. Located at Talyor street which is very accessible to practically everything. Short walk to Pier where you will see the Fisherman's Wharf logo. If you want to take the Trolley , two to three blocks away from the hotel will get you to the Powell and Mason Street line. Getting to Market street is very easy, just take the "F" line which will start just two blocks away from Hyatt. If you want to join a tour to anywhere from the city to Alcatraz to Yosemite, you can just cross the street and walk to the corner and get your tour at Super Sightseeing. It is not as lavish looking compared to other Hyatt hotels in SFO. Hotel Lobby is not that big but the Front desk personnel are helpful. Our room got a two double bed which is just about the right size. Bed was a little high but neatly made up. Parking is pricey and they only got valet service. Breakfast and meal service at the Hotel Restaurant is fairly priced and staffs are wonderful. Checking out is not a problem the concierge service are most willing to assist you just in case you want to get a cab even on wee hours..

Reviews.Title: “great location to stay at Fishermans Wharf.”
Reviews.Author: kiaussie
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel, we only had 1 complaint, and that was we had requested connecting or 2 rooms together, but we were a long way from each other. We had booked a long way in advance so thought that it would not be a problem, this was the only thing that we could fault, everything else made for a dream holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location close to Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: armisteadsue
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean. The location was ideal, 5-10 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf and all the "touristy" places. Within walking distance of Pier 39, Ghiradelli chocolate shop and lots of nice bars and restaurants. The hotel restaurant was very good - wine was a bit pricey, but I suppose you would expect that in a restaurant. We had a fabulous day out doing the Alcatraz tour and Bay cruise and would really recommend the hop on hop off bus tour as well. All in all a great start to our fly drive holiday, we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: tunisfish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and it is a great hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, the valet parking is fast, the rooms are spotless and well appointed and the location is good for walking to different places near the Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite SF Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: tw0thirds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night as a "staycation" with some friends using a free stay credit. This is my favorite Hyatt in SF as the rooms are recently remodeled and clean. The location is not my favorite, but it is very close to the tourist traps along Fisherman's Warf/Pier 39 if you are in to that stuff. The only issue was some really bad service in the hotel restaurant during breakfast. However, they were nice enough to comp one of our entrees. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wendycw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Helpful staff and spotlessly clean. Location superb for the piers and all their attractions. Breakfast was expensive in the hotel, so we went across the street to the "Holywood deli" were we had huge breakfasts every morning at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: honeysusie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location with trams nearby. Ten minutes walk to the heart of fishermans wharf. We went as a group of four female friends and requested two rooms with two beds in each room.This request was complied with with no fuss. Lovely comfy beds and plenty of pillows. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful even down to the maintainence man who kept me on the straight and narrow when I was wandering the corridors looking for ice. The meals we had there were very nice and reasonable especially the breakfast. I would not hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it to others. san Francisco is a lovely city and I would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessKent_England
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a multi-trip holiday in Sept 2010. The hotel is in the BEST location as it was ideal for all the tourist attractions we visited i.e. Alcatraz, Golden Gate cycle, Union Sq etc. The hotel itself was very clean and the people were friendly. Rooms were a decent size and beds were very comfy. Although the menu in the hotel restuarant was not very extensive, the food was nice but expensive as was the bar. We did not use the pool and jacuzzi due to lack of time and weather constraints.

Reviews.Title: “can't say enough good about it...location, food, staff, room, all excellent”
Reviews.Author: predatorlover
Reviews.Content: We came into San francisco three days before the start of a tour and didnlt want to spend our money for the ritzy St. Frances that The Tour had put us in, so we found this great hotel on Fishermans wharf. Set two streets back from the wharf, it was quieter but still within walking distance of the wharf, boudins bakery, alcatraz pier, etc. The staff could not have been nicer. My only complaint was that I needed to print sdomething and for some reason they didn't tell me there was a business center, instead they had me e-mail my document to the manager on duty and they printed it out at their computer - which was a little odd. But they went out of their way to accommodate me. In retrospect, i wonder if who I spoke with was a new employee, perhaps. Also they have a great restaurant, knuckles, attached to the hotel, where we ate each morning and two of our evenings that we came in late. The staff obviously enjoyed working their and it was a pleasure interacting with them. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you are willing to pay!”
Reviews.Author: Ruds10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 15 - 18 Sep 2010. We were lucky as we managed to convert our Hyatt points for 3 nights free stay. The location is very close to Fisherman's Wharf, less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. You be surprise as this hotel comes with a self service laundry as well and the rates were very reasonable. The room was very modern and the bed was comfortable. Our only complaint was the conceige. He did not seem bothered to assist. We took the city sighseeing hop on hop off bus which stops less than 10 minutes away from the hotel. You should try the seafood at the restaurants opposite the Fisherman's Wharf and not at Pier 39!

Reviews.Title: “SanFrancisco is a great city”
Reviews.Author: blondiegeorgia
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here.The rooms were nice and clean. The staff very helpful. This hotel is in a great location. You can walk to all the Tours,shops and resturants. I took the 3hr bus tour which took me all over the city. It was great. Also took a bus to the park. Met up with a friend and we drove to Nappa Valley , We went to a winery and took the tour.The scenery was wonderful from the winery.

Reviews.Title: “Not a single complaint about this Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: jgreat23
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency was exactly what we were looking for. The staff were always extremely welcoming as you entered and exited each day. The on site restaurant was very nice. We were suprised that it was not busier. The room was very clean and quiet. The locataion was perfect. Conveniently located for ease of walking to the rental car company, the Piers, restuarants etc. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: yaven
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at this hotel on a stopover in San Fran. The hotel was well located, in a quiet street a few minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf. Check in was straight forward. We stayed in a quiet room on the top floor (5th floor), and found the room to be tidy and a good size. A fridge & mini bar would have been a bonus, but wasn't really missed. We didn't have room service but enjoyed breakfast one morning at Knuckles. Just to point out to prospective visitors - all the hotels in Fisherman's Wharf are quite low level (5-ish levels), so the views will not be extensive. The city was in fog most of the time we were there anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and close to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Mom2kidsMississauga
Reviews.Content: All the staff are very friendly at this hotel. It's also very well situated for Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are very nice and the bathroom was large but the actual room was quite tight for 4 people (2 adults 2 kids). There are lots of rooms on the floor and our room was far from the elevators which meant it was very quiet, but a nuisance when we wanted to use the elevators. The pool is heated and nice (not a lot of people since use it since it's outside and San Francisco tends to be cool). There was more traffic at the hot tub. There's laundry on each floor but for some reason the cost of the washer is different on the 3rd and 4th floors. We didn't have a fridge in the room and requested one which was brought up quite quickly. There's only valet parking available and I believe it's $45/day or $6/hour. The streetcar turnaround is just a block up the street. It's also close to North Beach which you can go for an authentic Italian meal. Although the hotel was very nice, it was too tight for us for 6 nights. Also, I thought it was a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stopover in SFO”
Reviews.Author: Sanine
Reviews.Content: Friendly and welcoming check-in. Was upgraded from a standard room to a corner suite (without asking) and elaborately informed about facilities and freebies included in my rate. Room had recently been refurbished and offered excellent views over a busy (but not too noisy) street corner. Minibar consisted of a fairly decent coffeemaker, but sadly no in-room fridge - which I found a bit unusual for a suite. Bathroom was good if you don't mind the shower-curtained bathtub/shower combination; spacious enough and very clean. Fairly dated feel pervaded throughout the property, which seemed otherwise well-maintained. Room service menu was ok in terms of quality and price; I have seen considerably worse in similarly rated hotels. There are certainly lots of better alternatives available in the neighbourhood, though personally I am not a big fan of dining out on my own. Concierge was helpful and efficient in organising airport transfer, for which I had some very specific requirements. Generally very friendly and enthusiastic service throughout my stay. Recommended for the dedicated tourist (cable car and and Pier 39 are within walking-distance) or if you happen to have business in the area, otherwise probably a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: T0mmie
Reviews.Content: We ended our vacation in this city, which we love btw. We booked this hotel because of the rather good location. You can easily walk to the Golden Gate as you can downtown. Now we, as Europeans, are used to walking but you can also get a taxi or so. Walk to the GG is aprox one hour (if you keep a firm pace) and downtown would be some 20 mins max. The first impression of the hotel is that it is stylish. We were greeted friendly and checked in with almost no waiting time. We asked for an upgrade and got one with only a very small extra amount to pay. We stayed here for 3 nights. The pool is ok, Nothing much but you can enjoy the sun on the terrace which was great. Towel service included. The rooms are good. Everything you need is there. The shower was good, enough space to put your things, a small fridge and a flatscreen TV. We had a king bed and slept like babies. We did not hear any noise, outside or in. The room was kept clean perfectly. Coffeemaker worked good. We were assisted by ordering a cab for the next day and the concierge was really friendly. Even double checked to see if all was in order with the pickup time (plane to catch). We did not use the parkign garage because we had allready tyrned in our car upon arrival. We though that we could use the parking fee more wisely. Offcourseyou are reaaly close to the wharff so in the evening, if you don't want to go to far, you can still get some air outside. I would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Margo29
Reviews.Content: we were very pleased with our stay here . I like the style , the staff were helpful and the room and facilities spotless and well furnished. The only gripe was the $45 plus tax plus tip PER NIGHT !!!! for our car . The pool on level 3 roof top was fantastic ...we had it all to ourselves , so peaceful to chill out after sightseing .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mj187
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Passport Platinum Member, I am a bit biased towards Hyatt. The good service that I have experienced in other cities continued here with the friendly bell hop. Efficient Check-in and we had a reward certificate for complimentary bevarage (was sceptical about what this would be). When presented at check-in was surprised to be shown a list of drinks and food and could choose one from each list, we went with some Soda and fresh baked cookies. We had a call from Room Service just after 5pm to say that they were baking the cookies and will be along soon! Never really use in room dining but was impressed with the update. Room wise, we were in a deluxe corner room on the 5th floor, with a view of the gas station and cable car turnaround. We walked around the hotel to get to the cable car, and I don't think there are any real 'views' from any outer rooms I guess it might be nice to have a view of the pool but we only have 4 nights so were not overly fussed about this. The room also included a large refrigerator (as requested). If you want a refrigerator in your room, do remember to request this through the Hyatt E-concierge before you arrive (no extra charge), as I do not think that they are included in the rooms as standard. Furnishings very good, a few scuffs on the walls and the window blinds could do with replacing but nothing major. Coin operated washer/dryers are included in each floor (remember to have plenty of quarters if you think these will be required), quite handy as we were moving on to another city after this stay and felt a lot more comfortable with this than a local laundromat (some of which did not look too inviting). Breakfast was included in the package, otherwise would not have bothered (not worth $18 per person for buffet) although adequate, not of the quality have experienced in other similar Hyatt properties in the USA. Breakfast is taken in Knuckles Bar / Diner which is attached the the hotel and is not really big enough when the hotel is busy, but we were staying over Labor Day weekend. However, Knuckles is very good value for food and drinks during the day. You can walk to Fishermans Wharf in about 10 minutes, and then on to Pier 39 for all the tourist things including the sea lions and then the Alcatraz boats leave from Pier 33 (remember to book this in advance of your trip, we went on a Saturday and the next available tour to buy that day was the following Tuesday)! Great tip for a sightseeing tour - Gray Line operate a 2 hour tour in an open top double decker motorised cable car. It is only $20 and takes in all the usual sights. The tour leaves from Pier 39 hourly between 10am and 5pm. The driver is also the guide and the driver for our tour was hilarious! You can just pay on board.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: FVC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with friendly service, a good bar and cosy swimming pool. The standard bedrooms are spacious with ipod docking station, large TV and tea and coffee making facilities. The hoel was very busy during our stay with both business and leisure guests.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: aelau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights with our 15 year old son and ten year old daughter. When booking online, we agonized over whether or not to go with a suite or just the "Oversized Two Double Beds." We ended up booking the oversized room, not the suite. We were pleasantly surprised to discover that the "Oversized" room had a sectional sofa and refrigerator. We were also impressed with housekeeping who kept our room meticulously clean and stocked with supplies throughout our stay. Our room had no view, which was a bummer, but the outdoor pool was on the same floor and was nice. This hotel is conveniently located and right around the corner from a Trader Joe's if you need to stock up on fruit or beverages for your room. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if you can get a deal (beware of nickel/dime charges).”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights (business mixed with pleasure) and overall it was a good hotel. My favorite things about this hotel were: it's clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday. Rooms had nice updates (ipod docking station, flat screens) and modern decor, which I liked. Normal sized room with nice bathroom, except for the shower, which I thought was weird. It's almost like a steam shower but there is no door...quite odd because it allows water to splash out of it. The beds are very comfortable. We slept well every night. We had room service one night and it was great. The front desk customer service was good too- they were always willing to provide directions or see to our needs promptly. If you want to be in Fisherman's Warf, it's close to everything of that nature and some great places to eat. I liked other areas of SF more than the warf, but if that where you want to be, it's in the perfect location. Also I did like the pool area but it is not all that big and full of lkids all day long, so take note. My dislikes: They charge to use the internet in the business center and it is WAY overpriced. I am so sick of hotels that nickel and dime people like that. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge in the room. They didn't do the greatest job with the refreshments for our conference...they obviously only wanted to do the minimum and didn't refill coffee or anything like that. However, their conference facilities are really nice. Nice set of ballrooms. Also there is the 45 dollars a night parking fee-completely crazy but I guess the norm for that area. Wireless does not reach our room, but they have a seperate T-Mobile access which of course is an extra charge. Bottom line: I think you will like this hotel, but try to get a good deal on your rate because they will nickel and dime you to death.

Reviews.Title: “4th time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: baileyman
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We enjoy it so much that this was our 4th visit here and are committed to return again. The major attraction for us is that the rooms are a fair size, we get quiet coutyard view rooms which are always exceptionally quite ( I am a light sleeper). The beds are very comfortable, the pool and hot tub are great, having self serve laundry and I find the breakfast in the restaurant of good quality and reasonable price for a hotel. Staff are very helpful and accommodating. The location of the hotel is also fantastic being so close to the water and away from the hustle and bustle of downtown, yet many things are within walking distance or quick bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “FANCY HOTEL CLOSE TO EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: NTMNinc
Reviews.Content: Hyatt at Fisherman's WharfIS is a nice,clean and somewhat fancy hotel thats 2 blocks away from the wharf. Room are nice, clean and updated, We got an oversized room with 2 fullsize beds. Beds are comfy. Rooms have a coffeemaker(hidden, under the safe), Ipod player, safe, small fridge and a big and clean bathroom. It has a outdoor pool on the 3rd floor that kids love. There are plenty of places to eat. Parking fee is 45.00 overnight and I was told its 38.00 a few blocks away. I think this is one of the nices hotel in the area. Marriot is comparable and only a 2 minute walk. Hotel is recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “The economy did not help”
Reviews.Author: JorgeL2
Reviews.Content: I would stay longer if the room were cheaper...! since I have 2 weeks vacation, however I had to cut it back for just 5 days

Reviews.Title: “Worn out and poor quality furnishings”
Reviews.Author: smaragdpete
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt was very disappointing and quite expensive $260, even though they ugraded me to a so called $600 room it was worn and the furniture shabby. Certainly not up to the Hyatt standard. Would not patronize this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: ChrisS
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel as part of a pre-booked family holiday. We had interconnecting rooms facing the courtyard which, while having no view, provided to be excellent and quiet, with a fridge in the rooms. We didn’t eat in the hotel but used the cafes opposite for breakfast. While the Hollywood Café looked more popular, we found the breakfasts at the adjacent café just as good. For lunches on the go we used Burger King (from hotel turn right, first left, straight on two blocks) and Subway (in Anchorage Square, right, first left from hotel). We also noticed that Safeway (turn left, ahead two blocks) had premade sandwiches for sale. For best pizzas at the Wharf, the hotel’s concierge recommended Cioppino’s (turn left, first right, then left two blocks at the Wharf). We also had an excellent meal in the Mexican restaurant opposite there. Hard Rock Cafe (at Pier 39) is also good with teenagers. As mentioned previously, Starbucks (turn right, first right then ahead one block) has free internet (no password needed). On tourist things, don’t miss Alcatraz (15 minutes walk to pier, turn right from hotel then straight ahead). Fortunately we'd booked ahead (online) as, on the day we visited, earliest available tickets at the Pier were for 4 days later! Also, ride the Cable car ($5) adjacent to Starbucks up to the Cable Car Museum (free) and walk back down to the Wharf (40 minutes) for a good introduction to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: djbarnes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 7 & 10 year old children spent 4 nights at the Hyatt in July 2010. The location is excellent - close enough to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and the Cable Cars. The Knuckles Restaurant was good for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Parking is expensive, but that isn't unique to this hotel and I had quick access to my car (which is good to have to get to Muir Woods which I highly recommend). The staff was extremely friendly. The room was modern but not very large and it had an odd odor that never left (couldn't tell what the odor really was but I notice other reviews mentioned it too). The room had an air filter running in the room (which I could turn off but didn't) which made me wonder (not sure if all rooms have that). Aside from the odor (which really wasn't that big a deal), the only issue with the room was that there was no small refrigerator (which would have been helpful for storing milk for the kids) and there was almost no drawer space for clothing (which was just odd). Housekeeping was fine. The pool is small but the kids had fun. Coin laundry is located on several floors and while expensive was a nice convenience since this was our last hotel on a 16 day trip. Overall, this hotel met my expectations and I would definitely recommend the Hyatt to anyone staying in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: s4u4z
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with points so did not pay for this overnight. Very clean and nicely decorated hotel room. We had a room with two double beds and when we arrived were shocked at how small they were. Not easy when travelling with teenagers. Extremely quiet - never heard anything from below/above or in hallway. Hotel was full so check in was a bit slow but staff was helpful. The hardest working and most friendly/helpful are the valet parking staff. Parking is Valet only and $45 per day + tax.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION TO STAY!!!! 1 block to trolley cars, buses & street cars. 2 blocks from fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: cyny27
Reviews.Content: this location is great to stay especially if you have little kids. the cable car is one block away. you are just 2 blocks away from fisherman's wharf. a lot of places to eat by the water. you can even walk to the cruise (alcatraz) departure ports and aquarium. the bus is one block away, which can get you to golden gate park, golden gate bridge & exploratorium. GET A CITY PASS!! it's worth it!!!!! the street cars are also a block away. the only thing the hotel lacked on was the knowledge of their concierge. he gave some false info. for example. peter pan is playing there and he told me i could get last minute tickets at the ticket booth the day of the show - false!!. he also booked me a shuttle service on Lori's shuttle to the airport and I was told if my daughter sat on my lap she will not count. but of course after i got to the airport the drivers said i have to pay for two people. don't trust the concierge. get a city pass, and the city is easy to get around. the concierge has an excellent map of the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: krazz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive, but you can't beat the location. We walked to the ferry to Alcatraz and to dinner at Fisherman's Wharf. We met family in Chinatown within minutes. Breakfast was delicious. The staff was polite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TribalMembers
Reviews.Content: I liked it because of the friendly staff. clean, fairly large comfortable room. Nice proximity to fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz

Reviews.Title: “ideal basis to explore san francisco”
Reviews.Author: mundus
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal, just two blocks from the wharf and one block from the F streetcar line. On our arrival at the airport, we took the BART to Montgomery station and continued by bus 30. We had a reservation for an oversized poolside room, away from North Point street but on arrival we were upgraded to a suite directly on North Point street. Because pool side or courtyard side rooms are much more quiet (although a less attractive view), we insisted to have a quiet room. The reception needed more than 10 minutes to find an available oversized room with a courtyard view. But this room was absoloutely quiet. All amenities are availabe, iron and board and coffee maker. A walk-in shower instead of a bath tub was the only inconvenience because after an intercontinental flight we like to soak in a hot bath (but a shower uses less water.and is easier to maintain)

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: smhoge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for our anniversary in 2009. We stayed for a full week and loved how close the hotel was to the wharf as well as transportation into the downtown/Union Square area. We took a few tours while in SF and only had to walk across the street to board our tour bus! We purchased the breakfast package and enjoyed being able to visit the buffet in the hotel restaurant each day - the selection varied daily with choices such as pancakes, french toast, bacon/sausage/ham, assorted pastries, fruit and oatmeal. We never left hungry and felt the breakfast was a great value. We also dined in the hotel restaurant a couple times and ordered room service (after returning from the night tour at Alcatraz) and were not disappointed. Our room was comfortable, but noisy as it was located right next to the pool, the fitness center was also on the same floor as our room and while we were far enough away not to hear it, I'm sure guests closer to the gym could hear the 24 hour noise from treadmills/etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; Wonderful service; Great location”
Reviews.Author: jg02
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel with our two ten year old children and were very impressed. The hotel was much more expensive than the ones that we usually stay at, but it was well worth the splurge for just the two nights. We were able to walk just a few blocks to the wharf and the trolley cars. The hotel staff were exceptionally helpful, allowed us to check in a few hours early and even comped us breakfast (the buffet breakfast is very good also) when the specific room we wanted wasn't available. There are many restaurants closeby and, if you don't want to go out, several places deliver. The hotel pool and hot tub are well located (on the 3rd floor) which blocks most of the cool breezes off of the ocean and keeps them warm and comfortable. The fitness center had new equipment and was very nice. The concierge was extremely helpful with providing information on tours and giving directions. When you book this hotel, please remember that parking is very expensive ($45/day). Even if you park in another lot, the cost will be around $40/day. The valets at the hotel were very kind and very quick to get the car when we needed. Overall, we had a wonderful experience at this hotel and would return if we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: emptynester5
Reviews.Content: Forget the car (parking is $45.00 per night. Forget the pool it's to cold to swim. Forget the hotel restaurant. This hotel is close to all you need. The wharf, with great food, shopping and some nightlife and lots of action. Public transportation is practically right outside your door. The Cable Car, trolley, and Cabs and tour buses pick you up at the hotel. Buy a Muni Pass 1,3 or 5 day pas. The one day pass is $13.00 and gets you on most public transport plus 10% off at the Ghardelli Cholcolate Store. Take the tour of Alcatraz but book ahead on line and plan a half day for this tour. Bring a warm sweater or coat (or buy a coat for 20 bucks). You will need it often in San Francisco anyway. I'm told Mark Twain said, "The coldest winter I every spent, was a summer in San Francisco".

Reviews.Title: “Location near Pier 39”
Reviews.Author: beacholiday80
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel because of its location near the cruise port. We were very happy with the location. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying at Fisherman's Wharf Location, can't be beaten, right across from pier 39, close to the ferry to Alcatraz and near to the trolley bus stops into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel in the heart of fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: kschroen
Reviews.Content: While my husband was in SF on a business trip, I decided to tag along with my 2-year-old son to visit my sister, who lives within walking distance of the hotel. We decided to stay at the wharf because we wanted to be within walking distance to family tourist attractions. The Hyatt is a charming boutique hotel. We were immediately upgraded to a corner suite, which very comfortably served all of our needs for our 3-night stay. The front desk and bell staff were very nice, but the concierge could have been more helpful. The hotel isn't too kid friendly (ie, no special attention given to my son as he has had in other hotels), but for the location, cleanliness and value, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a fun time!”
Reviews.Author: tu2rgirl
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us because we had no idea of where anything was in San Francisco. She did a great job because we were in the midst of everything any tourist would want to see and do. The hotel is (obviously) on Fisherman's Wharf, with all its attractions practically at the hotel's doorstep. The room was modern and clean, as was the entire place. We had a room overlooking the pool, which I thought would be quiet because it was cold. Surprisingly, lots of kids were in the pool in the evening even though the air temp was in the 50s, and, at times they could be loud. On the plus side, we had easy access to the hot tub, so we used the pool area during the day--quietly. This amenity was quite a plus. By the way, if you want to park at this hotel, it's $45 a night. We didn't have a car, but be forewarned if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe yes...mostly no.”
Reviews.Author: redvisorman
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit torn on this review as the service here was quite good and the staff seemed very friendly and willing to help, but the room was definitely remodelled quite hastily and it showed. Also, as I was incapacitated during my trip, I found their wheelchair access to be a bit sub-par, e.g. the door to the room barely had enough space to get the chair through, and there is only one elevator from the main lobby upstairs, unless you walk down a half-flight of stairs en route to the other two elevators...make sense? Regardless, as I have found with my new condition, many places are "Handicap accessible" but not "Handicap friendly". The food here is good, but like everywhere in this area way over priced. Pretty good location for getting around, and nice amenities, but I guess I simply expect more out of the facilities at a place with the name "Hyatt". This meaning that the shower lever doesn't come off in my hand, the wallpaper isn't peeling and the toilet paper dispenser hasn't been replaced poorly with the old screw holes merely painted over. All in all, I think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: pw9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because Hyatt was offering a special rate. The location is only a couple of short blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions. The hotel was nice, but the rooms looked a little worn. Valet parking is the only parking on site and is expensive (about $45/night). Watch the valets, as they marked my ticket showing damage to the car when they wasn't any damage on the car. When challenged, they gave me half off parking. Nice, but is this their standard MO for receiving cars? Buffet breakfast was nice but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay - Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: RESTISBEST
Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff - Clean Rooms - located in Fisherman's Wharf - short walking distance to many attractions and street car/cable/bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt letdown”
Reviews.Author: coasttraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Fishermans close to cable car turnaround. The hotel was fair with a reasonable room size and the usual tips applied to the staff. Requesting a fridge by maintenance staff was provided and due to the fridge noise was not used during our stay. There was no view from the room which looked out onto other rooms and it was quite dark. We had breakfast on our last morning which overall extremely disappointing with a poor selection of hot food. On the plus side the check staff were very friendly and helpful. Next time we visit we would stay downtown close to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Fisherman's Wharf Area Stay”
Reviews.Author: B4297
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four nights at the Hyatt....well situated near Hyde St. cable car turnaround, Wharf,etc. Very friendly staff, outdoor heated pool, comfortable beds. Couldn't have been a nicer stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW What a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mdahlstrom
Reviews.Content: My girlfreind and I arrived at the Hotel and were greeted by my last name. The service was prompted and friendly. At check in I was approached like I was the most important person at the hotel. Our room was perfect and the bed was more comfortable than at home. Perfect location for all the attractions. My review is WOW!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kolinamae
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great room! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I traveled with my 18 month old daughter and the only downside was that I didn't have a refrigerator to put her milk in but I bought a small carton and put in a bucket of ice. Other than that...I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: gatordiner
Reviews.Content: In town to SF for the first time. This is great location if you want to walk to the wharf (5 min), cable car stop (5 min), .g. square (10 mn). Staff is friendly and helpful. Based on a previous review I requested a quiet room and was glad I did as some of the rooms face the street and the tourist buses run by there. Rooms are modern. The few negatives was no free wi fi. We ate at Gary Danko which is literally a 3 minute walk from the hotel (but that is another review). i would stay here again if I wanted a great touristy location in sf.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and an awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: Shar_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: This place is close to all the tourist attractions at Fishermans wharf. The beds are awesome. Felt safe to walk around at night. Good spot especially if you only have a short time in San Fran and want to be able to see the sights

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: djblcalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf. It is also a block from a cable car stop, which allows access to many other locations. Request a room facing the courtyard. You won't get much of a view but it will be nice and quiet. Hotel staff is courteous - concierges are knowledgable. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & nice facility”
Reviews.Author: Clarkthehorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a conference and was very pleased. Best part: super friendly and helpful staff, from the front desk to housekeeping to room service delivery. Really made the difference in my stay. Other pluses: room service food was excellent; room very clean overall; good soundproofing between rooms. My room was also decent-sized for an urban hotel. No big negatives. It's a few blocks walk to Fisherman's Wharf so convenient, but since it's not right on the Wharf, you're missing views and the ambiance, as well. And to the Hyatt decorating team ... next time you paint, brighten it up a bit! Lots of greys and dark colors make the place awfully drab. Overall, though, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to experience San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mlnrp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are both gold passport platinum members so we try to stay at Hyatt if at all possible. There are three Hyatts in San Francisco. We stayed away from the Hyatt Regency SF because it is too business oriented. We stayed for three nights at a rate of $119 per night + tax with a $25 food and beverage credit (which we used at their Knuckles restaurant) and a 1500 bonus Hyatt points. We are very happy we stayed at Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf because it is within walking distance to some of our favorite restaurants and attractions such as restaurant Gary Danko, The House, Slanted Door restaurant, Alcatraz landing, and Pier 39. The rooms are clean, the bed is very comfortable and I like the many electrical outlets right at the desk for charging our electronics. The valet parking at $45 per night is pricey but we saved parking fees elsewhere because most of the places we went to were within walking distance. During peak check-in hours, we feel the staff was a bit overwhelmed including lines at the concierge desk and our luggage not being delivered in a proper and timely manner. In our room, the safety deposit box is located too high in the closet so it is hard to see to make sure you didn't leave any of your personal items behind. The rain shower head is annoying when it is not an addition to a standard shower head...and the doorless walk-in shower looks cool but not practical as the glass panel is not long enough to contain water spills. The flat screen TV is nice but a bit too far if you are sitting on the bed. If you wish to take a nap during the afternoon and you have a street facing room, don't be surprised if you hear tour bus guides narrating on a loud speaker. Overall, despite the above negatives, we will stay here again because of the comfortable bed, cleaniness and the good location. Next time we plan to return to this hotel and ask for a room which faces away from the street. We plan to try out the bike tour across Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito (we noticed many bike rentals in this area), we may also look into the Segway tours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: chowc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Positive: - this is a perfect location for a tourist. Right in Fisherman's Wharf area with all attractions and shops and restaurants. One cable car line is right behind this hotel and another one is walkable distance away. - Got a good value package with AAA (was requested to show the card at check-in and thank god I remembered to bring it) which include hot buffet breakfast for two. - the staff (Alice and others) in the breakfast area were very nice. - love the fragrance of the lotion/shampoo Negative - small room - no free internet Tip to hotel: if you want the guests to re-use towels, then please provide more hooks in the bathroom to allow them to be air dry. How do you expect guests to re-use wet towels? -

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: prospect316
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel in most happening part of SF. So much to do and see. Close enough to walk. Bars and restuarants everywhere,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good base”
Reviews.Author: SouthEnglandGazania
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate a special occasion.. booked it on a 'low-cost' website even though this hotel was not the cheapest in Fishermans Wharf, it is very well located for all main attractions, Fishermans Wharf and good local restaurants. Rooms finished to a good standard. Staff on front desk very approachable and helpful in dealing with requests such as booking visit to Alcatraz. Local restaurant called 'Fog Harbour' located upstairs in Fishermans Wharf is excellent for food - highly recommend the Fresh Prawns in Chilli with warm crusty bread! Also recommend the 'GoCar' half day rental where you rent a go-kart type car (for 2 people) and the onboard GPS guides you round all the major attractions, and it is mainly off-road so dont have to worry about other vehicles. Had a lovely time here; the hotel is not amazing but is very well located to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in the Wharf.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Got a rate of 155/night. The place is really nice, clean sleek lines and furniture. Staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, but a tad on the dark side for decor. The bathroom is cool, but having only a rainshower as an option is not cool, and a half shower door leads to many puddles when you get out. Maid service was good. Got a fridge without a hassle and no fee for it. Parking is a rip, but in SF, there is no other option. Knuckles, the restaurant is great food, a little costly, but the drinks are good and 18 dollars for a knockout breakfast buffet is awesome. Overall, very happy with the place and price, basically a W hotel feel minus the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four nights at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We upgraded to an Executive Suite and the space was wonderful. While the sparse feng shui feel to the rooms is not to my taste, the bed was very comfortable and we had no problem sleeping. The hotel is very convenient for all transportation options and a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. My biggest complaint about the hotel was the daily internet charge. However, we did receive a $25.00/per day food allowance which allowed us to have breakfast on the house. The $45.00/day parking fee was a little over the top but the parking service was excellent and we never had to wait for our car. The staff was pleasant and helpful and they do have a complimentary service for printing your boarding pass. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and the menu was quite sufficient for anyone's taste. This hotel is quite a good option if you are staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area. It appeared to be a little more upscale than surrounding hotels (excluding the Fairmont at Ghirardelli Square) and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Kind of a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time here. We aren't crazy about staying in Fisherman's Wharf area as it dies early but the cable car stops right behind the hotel & the streecars go a block to the front. If you buy a one week pass (about $25) you can use it all very cheaply but buying single rides on the cable car is very expensive-we would have spent 5 times that much. The hotel is clean, quiet and well serviced. We spent only about $115/night after taxes (geezer rate). In my opinion there are few places at Fisherman's Wharf worth eating but the cable car gets you close to North Beach & all the way to Union Square. A few blocks walk to the Hyde Street car & it will drop you at the door of Frascati which is wonderful. Also it is a nice long walk mostly along the beach to the Golden Gate. If you are tired of walking take the bus back to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf -- a perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: wmw132s
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf in September 2009. Was very happy with the location. This was our first visit to San Francisco, and we were so happy to find ourselves close to everything. The Wharf itself is within walking distance of the hotel, as was Lombardo Street, Ghirardelli Square and several other attractions. AT&T Park, the Alcatraz Tour dock, etc. were just a short cab ride from the hotel. The hotel itself was very contemporary and modern. The rooms were a tad bit dark, but comfortable. My only complaint on the room was the design of the shower. The water would easily sprinkle and run from the shower out into the bathroom itself, and since there was no door on the shower, this was unavoidable. You would find youreself having to mop up the floor afterwards. Otherwise, the rooms were nice. There is a sports bar in this hotel called Knuckles, and we had a lot of fun watching a ballgame there. The food was good, the beer was cold. A nice way to end a busy day of walking and sight-seeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying at Fisherman's Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAspanut
Reviews.Content: We have truly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is very clean and modern. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff who really know the area, and made good recommendations for dinner and sight seeing. If you can get away during the week, you can get some great deals on rates here too. The tourists are gone, so the City is yours. We had the best time, and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night (New Year's Day). I was impressed with the hotel rooms - they exceded my expectations. They were on the small side but very clean, well appointed, and had a comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom had a rainshower in it which was fun (there is no bathtub). Free tube of toothpaste which was great because we'd just run out! Staff was extremely friendly - I don't really pay much attention to the staff one way or the other (unless they are super rude) but the friendlyness in everyone we encountered at the Hyatt was noticable. Location to Fisherman's Wharf is perfect (2 blocks away)- you're in the heart of everything but just far enough away from the main tourist drag so that it's not loud or crazy (because it is crazy down there - be prepared for tourists galore). The one dissapointing thing about this hotel is parking - $45 per day!!! I live in Chicago so I know that parking can be expensive at hotels in urban areas but $45 is crazy! We asked if there was another option and the woman checking us in pointed us to a garage (just one block away) that was $32 per day - still a lot, but we were glad to save some money. We unloaded the car in the valet area and then parked it ourselves. It looked like there were some other lots in the area that might have been cheaper (if you don't care about in/ out privlages) but we needed the car later that night so we decided to just park it in this garage. Our room came with a $25 food and bev credit so we went to Knuckles for breakfast the next day. It was just OK (foodwise) service was great. Eggs were very runny and for the price we definitely wouldn't have eaten here if not for the food credit. We found a good rate on Hyatt's website ($145 for the room and a $25 food credit) so even with the expensive parking we thought this was a pretty good deal in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Price gouging parking fee detracts from this fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajgoaguy
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for under $100 thru Priceline over the christmas weekend. Everything was fair to pretty good, BUT if you are driving, the hotel guest Parking fee is $45/night! And this is only Valet parking, so with tip it is more like a $50 parking fee! Street parking is also very limited in the Fisherman's wharf area, though there are a few spots. They also charge for WIFi ($10/day) or $7/15 minutes in the Business Center. So I'd recommend this hotel only if you are not driving!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Hyatt Option in SF”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Just completed a three night stay here. Being a GP Diamond I use Hyatt when I can. Unfortunately in a great luxury hotel town there is no 5 star product from the chain, with the conversion of the old Park Hyatt into a Starwood joint. Of the 3 remaining properties, FW provided an excellent rate so we booked it, not expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms have been updated in a contemporary style and are not tired or worn out. Service friendly. GP Dlamond status was acknowledged and we were upgraded to a suite. There is no Regency Club but breakfast was comped and all the Diamond perks were provided. The food we did have was very good with the exception of Fish and Chips from room service. The best tour operator is literally right across the street, and all the tourist attractions of the area are within a short walk. Negatives include issues with the Internet, freezing public areas and problems getting properly credited for my points, post stay. All in all an excellent value and we will most likely stay again if we stick with Hyatt when in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: danielrh909
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely recommend this Hyatt for a lot of reasons, but I'll list what I think the pros and cons are so that prospective guests can make up their own minds about the place. Pros: The biggest thing is the location. It's just a block or so from a lot of the touristy attractions, which are a little cheezy but still a lot of fun. It's also a relatively short walk away from a lot of the cool San Francisco sights as well. They also have a really friendly and helpful staff. The concierge in particular was awesome and gave me perfect directions that saved me a lot of time and hassle. Also, they have the most comfortable bed I ever slept in and the rooms were really spacious and clean. But perhaps the biggest pro for me personally was the great deal I got. Granted, I went in a totally non-typical time of the year in the middle of December, but I felt like I got a heck of a bargain by only paying around $110 a night. Cons: They really could use an indoor pool. San Francisco is pretty cool most of the year, so having one outside doesn't make a whole lot of sense. They should also really look into finding a way of making the rooms quieter. The location and hotel was pretty quiet in general, but some rowdy younger kids woke me up a few times at night. I'm glad those kids were having fun, and realize that the hotel can't really do much about that. But they could look into insulating the door jams a bit better to prevent this. But for me personally the biggest con is that there are really no frills. Well, there are, but at a high price. It doesn't make sense to me that you pay LESS a night at a nice place like the Hampton Inn and get things like free wifi and free breakfast. Paying a bit more at a place like a Hyatt and not getting those kind of things sort of stinks. But those cons aren't that big of a deal. It's still a great hotel and I'd totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Richardf100
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, booked through Hotwire so value was great. Facilities and staff were excellent. Hotel is in an ideal location for sight seeing, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: EpsteinAustralia
Reviews.Content: Hotel very centrally located. Excellent service provided by staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, near to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of road trip to Las Vegas and Northern California. I flew in from LV, and at cab is around $40 from SFO to hotel. Very efficent check in, with friendly staff. The location is very good, just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Stayed in Rm 234, two double beds. Room was very clean, and large. Feels new. Large flat screen TV, with plenty of channels. Ipod , clock etc all there. Coffee making facilities in room,. Bathroom was fine. Great shower. Comfortable beds. There was a pool and gym, although I didn't use. Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby, i felt safe in neighbourhood. no problems. i would fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was fishing for”
Reviews.Author: grande7
Reviews.Content: I had paid for a room for two and two breakfasts. As I went by myself I asked if I could have credit for the breakfast for internet etc. No go unlike the classy Grove Park Inn in Ashville that offered me dinner for the same arrangement. I then moved to the Handledy(sp) and had a bigger, nicer room for less money right on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: shmookey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. It was a short walk to all the action on Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel staff were great, the rooms were very clean and attractive. My girlfriend and I paid the little extra and had a huge room. Our friends did not get the extra large room. Their rooms were also very nice, but a little on the small side. The lounge as well as the lobby are also very clean and nice. The pool and hottub are well looked after and pleasant to relax in. From the minute we drove up in our taxi cab until we drove away 4 days later, we were treated like VIP! We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but the rooms were lacking”
Reviews.Author: pyrettablaze999
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay in San Fran, however the bathrooms at the Hyatt were lacking. The shower reminded me of something that is built outside on those tropical islands. The water stream was not adjustable and sprayed straight down, even though the shower area was huge. It was not completely closed in either, so I always felt a draft and the water spray was not enough to compensate. Other than the shower situation, the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff.”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
